title: How New Zealand built a fan base in Japan which will come to the fore during the Rugby World Cup semi-final
text:
They love animals in Tokyo where you can find cafes dedicated to cats, owls, miniature-pigs and hedgehogs. The only creature the Japanese do not seem to appreciate are underdogs. As Eddie Jones, the England head coach, pointed out this week, “There are 120 million Japanese people out there whose second team are the All Blacks.”

For once, Jones was only guilty of mild embellishment. England supporters heading to the Yokohama International Stadium tomorrow will find themselves engulfed in a sea of black. Ever since Japan were eliminated in the quarter-finals, the hosts’ allegiance has shifted firmly behind New Zealand. Dark merchandise has flown off the shelves of the World Rugby megastore in Shinjuku....
